task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 54°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I am currently facing the target building at approximately 55° NE; to estimate its height accurately, I need to look upward to see the full structure from ground to roof.
I am currently looking up at 30° pitch but may not yet see the full height of the building; I should tilt further upward to capture the roofline against the sky for accurate height estimation.
I am still at 30° pitch and may not have captured the full height of the building; I will rotate further upward to ensure the roofline is visible for accurate estimation.
I have repeatedly tilted up but may be stuck at the same pitch; I need to reset my view and attempt a larger upward adjustment to capture the full building height.

At 60° pitch, I can now see the top of the building against the sky; combining this view with known human-scale references (e.g., window heights ~1.5m), I estimate the building is approximately 24 meters tall.
